pli-tv-pvr2.3:0.4.eng: The classes of failure for each offense

pli-tv-pvr2.3:1.1.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.3:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for a lustful nun consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.3:1.2.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.3:1.2.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.3:1.3.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr2.3:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.3:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for asking for curd and then eating it, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.3:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.3:2.2.eng: They belong to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.3:3.1.eng: The classes of failure for each offense, the third, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.4:0.4.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense

pli-tv-pvr2.4:1.1.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr2.4:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for a lustful nun consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her, in how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.4:1.2.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ tīhi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr2.4:1.3.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.4:1.3.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr2.4:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr2.4:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for asking for curd and then eating it, in how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.4:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ dvīhi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr2.4:2.3.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing acknowledgment; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr2.4:3.1.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense, the fourth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.5:1.1.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.5:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for a lustful nun consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.5:1.2.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ ekena samuṭṭhānena samuṭṭhanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.5:1.3.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.5:1.3.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for asking for curd and then eating it, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ catūhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.3.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhanti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.3.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.4.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhanti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.4.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.5.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.5.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr2.5:2.6.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti.

pli-tv-pvr2.5:3.1.eng: The originations of each offense, the fifth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.6:0.4.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs

pli-tv-pvr2.6:1.1.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr2.6:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for a lustful nun consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her, to which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.6:1.2.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ—āpattādhikaraṇaṃ …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.6:1.2.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense. …

pli-tv-pvr2.6:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr2.6:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for asking for curd and then eating it, to which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.6:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ—āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.6:2.2.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr2.6:3.1.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs, the sixth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.7:1.1.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.7:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for a lustful nun consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.7:1.2.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.7:1.3.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.7:1.3.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr2.7:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.7:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses for asking for curd and then eating it, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.7:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.7:2.3.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr2.7:2.3.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr2.7:3.1.eng: How each offense is settled, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:0.4.eng: Summary of the previous six sections

pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.1.pli: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantī kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.1.eng: When a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.2.pli: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.2.eng: She commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.3.pli: Adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ gahaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.3.eng: when she consents to him taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.4.pli: ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ gahaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.4.eng: when she consents to him taking hold of her above the collar bone or below the knees, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.5.eng: when she consents to him taking hold of something connected to her body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.6.pli: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyantī imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.2.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.3.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.4.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.5.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.6.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.6.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.7.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.8.eng: They are found in three classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.9.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.9.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.11.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.11.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.12.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.13.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.14.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.14.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantī kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.1.eng: When asking for curd and then eating it, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.2.eng: She commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.3.eng: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.4.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.5.pli: dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantī imā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.2.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.3.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.4.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.5.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.6.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.6.eng: They belong to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.8.eng: They are found in two classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.9.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing acknowledgment; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.11.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhanti na vācato na cittato,
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.11.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhanti na cittato,
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.12.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.13.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti na vācato,
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.13.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.14.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.15.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.16.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.17.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.17.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:5.1.eng: The summary of the previous six sections, the eighth, is finished.
